title: [Large-Scale] Language Practical Competency Enhancement Course Using Simulation-Based Digital Platforms: Text Analysis, Writing, Communication Optimization, and Advanced Expression Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency (grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension, writing) and practical experience. Requires digital platform utilization skills and foundational understanding of PBL (Problem-Based Learning)
context.additional_context: A course where professionals enhance language application skills (text analysis, writing, communication) through simulation models reflecting real work environments. Features customized learning environments using personal devices (BYOD) and feedback-driven improvements in expressive/reading skills, with emphasis on professionalism through context-appropriate vocabulary usage and grammatical structure analysis.

learning_goals: Learners complete language practical tasks (e.g., customer response text analysis, business report writing) with over 85% accuracy on a simulation-based digital platform, demonstrating professional communication skills through optimized vocabulary selection and grammatical structures.

Learners demonstrate a 30%+ improvement in language task processing speed (e.g., document comprehension, email response generation) via pre-post test comparisons and show balanced development in reading comprehension and expressive abilities.

Within a 5-day PBL project period, learners analyze two simulation models based on real-world scenarios (e.g., vocabulary selection strategies for handling customer inquiries, project schedule management reporting), and through team collaboration, submit a 3-page proposal including grammar, vocabulary, and expression optimization plans. They achieve 'Excellent' or higher in at least four of five evaluation rubric criteria: accuracy, creativity, practicality, collaboration, and completeness.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
